userProfile.goal: Climber physique (Wire-strong, vascular, no bulk) + 20 lbs Weight Loss

injuryProtocol.name: Golfer's Elbow
injuryProtocol.description: Currently feeling strain near the funny bone (inner elbow)

dailyRehab.name: Forearm Smash
dailyRehab.description: Massage the meaty part of your inner forearm with a lacrosse ball/hard object

rules: Use [ELBOW SAFE] alternatives listed for at least 2 weeks
Do not return to standard exercises until you can hang from a bar pain-free
Use lifting straps for Deadlifts/Rows to offload the grip

tuesday.goal: Core Routine + 45m Steep Hike + Deep Stretch

morning.name: Morning Stretch
morning.description: Do this right after you wake up. The goal is to open up your hips and upper back, which get stiff from sleeping.

exercises.name: Deep Squat Hold
exercises.description: Opens ankles, knees, and hips for the day. Essential for the "high step" moves in climbing.
exercises.why: Opens ankles, knees, and hips for the day
exercises.action: Drop into the deepest squat you can. Keep heels flat. Use your elbows to push your knees out. Rock side to side gently.

exercises.name: Thoracic Openers / T-Spine Rotation
exercises.description: Prevents developing a "hunchback" posture from all the pulling and carrying.
exercises.why: Prevents hunchback posture from pulling and carrying
exercises.action: On hands and knees, put one hand behind your head. Rotate that elbow down to touch the opposite wrist, then rotate it all the way up to the ceiling. 30 seconds per side.

exercises.name: Dead Hang
exercises.description: Decompresses your spine and wakes up your grip.
exercises.why: Decompresses spine and wakes up grip
exercises.action: Just hang from a bar (or doorframe if sturdy). Let your back crack and pop.

night.name: Night Stretch
night.description: Do this 30 minutes before bed. The goal is to lengthen the muscles that tightened up during your run or lift.

exercises.name: Couch Stretch
exercises.description: The #1 stretch for you. Running and hiking tighten the hip flexors. Tight hip flexors cause lower back pain and "weak" glutes.
exercises.why: Fixes tight hip flexors from running and hiking
exercises.action: Kneel in front of a couch (or wall). Put one shin vertical against the couch cushion behind you. Squeeze your glute and stand tall. You should feel a massive pull in the front of your hip/thigh. 60 seconds per side.

exercises.name: Doorway Pec Stretch
exercises.description: Climbers and heavy lifters tend to roll their shoulders forward. This opens the chest so you can breathe better and stand taller.
exercises.why: Opens chest for better breathing and posture
exercises.action: Put your forearms against a doorframe at 90 degrees. Step through gently until you feel a stretch across your chest.

exercises.name: Child's Pose with Side Reach
exercises.description: Loosens the lats (from all the pull-ups) and the lower back (from the RDLs and hiking).
exercises.action: Kneel, sit back on your heels, and reach arms far forward on the floor. Then, walk both hands to the left (stretches right lat), hold, then walk to the right.
